title: Who was Mouls and what was his impact on society and science?
first_phrase: In this last part of the text, the author pays tribute to the late chanoine Mouls, a man of courage, honesty, and modesty, who died in extreme poverty. Mouls was a talented speaker and writer, but his publications were poorly organized and lacked cohesion. Despite this, Mouls possessed a rare erudition and a deep understanding of historical and religious issues. The author reflects on Mouls' character and concludes that he was a man of conviction who never wavered in the face of adversity. The text also touches on Mouls' revolt against the aggressive dogma of the Catholic Church and his persecution for his heterodox views.
content: On doit la vérité aux morts. » Mais si, esprit un pou timide, craintif, et trop surmené, que devaient nécessairement obséder des fatigues sans repos et des efforts sans récompense, si Mouls était inapte à la production d’œuvres complètes, ses écrits révèlent néanmoins partout de l’habileté, de la finesse, de la promptitude à saisir, une grande facilité d'assimilation, un jugement honnête, de la clairvoyance et une sérieuse érudition, surtout en ce qui regarde les questions religieuses, dont il parlait très compétemment. » Un mot encore. » Au milieu des épreuves cruelles son cœur n’a point faibli, son âme n’a jamais failli à ses nouvelles convictions, ce sera là l’éternel honneur do sa mémoire. Mouls sans doute pouvait retrouver un refuge, peut-être même de nouveaux honneurs, dans le giron do l’Eglise catholique en abjurant ses prétendues emours, en exposant son repentir. Mais il n’a point fléchi, et cependant tout l’accablait à lafois ! Lui, F ex-chanoine autrefois au sein de l’abondance et saturé de flatteries, il savait supporter stoïquement la faim, il savait subir des humiliations injustes; mais il n’eût point voulu mériter un affront, se reprocher une lâcheté ou une bassesse.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the study of somnambulism and its provocation presents both physiological and psychological challenges, but it deserves to be approached with an open and curious mind. The notion that only hysterical subjects can be put into a sleepwalking state is a common misconception; on the contrary, individuals with a strong constitution and a focused mind may be more easily susceptible to it. While the validity of such phenomena may be subject to doubt, it is important to remember that even errors can contain kernels of truth, and that scientific progress often arises from the pursuit of seemingly unattainable goals.
